meanings.definition: To make oneself or something appear fuller or rounder by adding weight or volume.
meanings.sent1: She plumped the pillow to make it fluffier.
meanings.sent2: The baker plumped up the dough before baking it.
meanings.sent3: The cat plumped itself on the soft cushion, looking content.
meanings.sent4: The flowers plumped up after a good watering, blooming beautifully.
meanings.sent5: He plumped the cushions on the couch, making it inviting for guests.

meanings.definition: To support or make a decision with strong or enthusiastic approval.
meanings.sent1: The team plumped for the new strategy enthusiastically.
meanings.sent2: She plumped for the candidate with unwavering support.
meanings.sent3: The audience plumped for the comedian, laughing at every joke.
meanings.sent4: The students plumped for the idea of a class party, excitedly discussing plans.
meanings.sent5: He plumped for the proposal, believing it would lead to success.
